Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay lets tackle this problem step by step First I need to understand the normative process described and then check each case in the event log against it

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The process starts with Receive order and then Check inventory Depending on inventory availability the process branches

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: If inventory is sufficient 1 After Check inventory next should be Authorize payment 2 Then Package items followed by Ship order then Close order The sequence here is Check  Authorize Payment  Package  Ship  Close

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: If inventory is insufficient 1 After Check inventory it should go directly to Cancel order then Close order No other steps like Authorize Package or Ship should come after Cancel

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Key constraints  Authorize payment must come after Check inventory and before Package items  Package items must be after Authorize payment and before Ship order  Ship order must come after Package items and only in the sufficient inventory path  Cancel order must be followed only by Close order no steps after Cancel except Close  Close order must always be the last activity

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now lets go through each case Case 1 Activities Receive  Check  Authorize  Package  Ship  Close This follows the sufficient inventory path exactly No issues here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Sequence Receive  Check  Package  Authorize  Ship  Close The problem here is that Authorize payment comes after Package items The normative process requires Authorize to be before Packaging So the order of Authorize and Package is flipped here which violates the rule that you cant package before authorizing payment

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Sequence Receive  Check  Authorize  Cancel  Ship  Close Wait after Cancel order there should be no activities except Close But here after Cancel they did Ship which is a violation Also Authorize payment after Check but then they went to Cancel Thats conflicting because if inventory is insufficient they shouldnt have authorized payment The norm says that once inventory is checked if insufficient Cancel immediately So Authorize should only happen if inventory is sufficient so in this case if they canceled then the Authorize is also a violation because you cant authorize if inventory was insufficient So two violations Authorize before Cancel when inventory was insufficient so shouldnt have authorized and then Ship after Cancel

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 4 Sequence Receive  Check  Cancel  Close This looks correct for insufficient inventory No issues here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Sequence Receive  Check  Authorize  Ship  Close Missing Package items between Authorize and Ship The norm requires that after Authorize you must Package before Shipping So skipping Package and going straight to Ship is a violation Also since they didnt package shipping without packaging is against the rules Additionally the order skips a required step so thats an error

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait also check if in case 5 after Authorize they went directly to Ship That skips Package So thats definitely violating the Package step before Shipping

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now let me list the violations per case Case 2  Package occurs before Authorize Payment This breaks the rule that Authorize must come before Packaging Case 3  Authorize Payment occurred even though they later Cancel Since they ended with Cancel the inventory must have been insufficient Therefore Authorize should not have happened Also after Cancel they did Ship which is not allowed So two violations here Case 5  Missing Package items between Authorize and Ship So Ship occurs without prior Packaging Also the sequence skips a required step which is a violation Other cases 1 and 4 are okay

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Wait let me check again For case 3 the steps are Check inventory sufficient Or not Since they canceled inventory was insufficient So after Check they should go straight to Cancel But they first did Authorize Payment which is not allowed when inventory is insufficient So thats a violation Then they did Cancel but after that they Ship which is also wrong So three issues here Or two main points Authorize before Cancel which shouldnt happen and Ship after Cancel

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 5 The correct path after Authorize should be Package first then Ship but they went Authorize  Ship missing Package So thats a violation

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 2 The order is Check  Package wrong then Authorize So the Authorize is after Package which is wrong The norm requires Authorize before Package

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3 also has an extra issue after Cancel they did Ship Thats a big nono

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Alright so cases 2 3 and 5 are violating the process Let me confirm each step again

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3s path After Check they Authorize then Cancel Wait the logic is after Check if inventory is insufficient you must Cancel immediately So Authorizing before Cancel would mean that even though inventory was insufficient they still authorized payment Thats a critical error because payment authorization shouldnt happen unless inventory is sufficient So thats a major violation Then after Cancel they proceeded to Ship which is another big violation

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 5 After Authorize they go to Ship without Packaging So missing the required step between Authorize and Ship

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 2 The sequence after Check is to Package before Authorize which is wrong order

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So the violating cases are 235 Case4 is okay Case1 is correct

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Now need to explain each violation clearly based on the normative description
